column4: how do I edit my "Places" menu at the top of the screen? I want to add a folder.
I've been trying to get skype to work in ubuntu for days. I've read a bunch of things on it, but nothing seems to work.
What's the problem?
no sound
I try echo123 test and hear nothing
I see. Do you have a music player running or open at the same time?
no
Hm. I see. Have you dealt with things such as ALSA and ESD yet?
I tried the stuff in the ubuntuguide, but it didn't seem to work, then Seveas told me not to use the ubuntuguide so I undid it.
I didn't know what I was doing, I just followed the instructions
There is a howto that worked for me. However, I believe sound may have been working for me out of the box.
I tried killing off esd
sound seems to work in other apps ok for me
was the howto on the wiki or somewhere else?
Try this guide http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=32063&pp=10&highlight=Failed+construct+test+pipeline
if I can't get it working in the next couple hours, I will have to do something drastic. Like boot into windows :)
yeah that guide is interesting, it is similar to the ubuntuguide suggestions but takes it a step or two further. I know it can work because skype used to work under Mandrake for me (which I removed)

Sweet. I went through a small bout with tryig to get Skype sound to work simultaneously with a music player. So I know of just about every guide out there. I ended up buying a sound card in the end since onboard sound doesn't support it.
hi again, I rebooted. now I can't play any sounds.
but I wonder, I don't see anything in the ps aux, when I grep for esd or alsa, I'm wondering shouldn't I have something like that running as a sound demon?
I think it is your asound.cond that is causing it.
Right, me too.
and crimsun: I went into the volume control and unmuted the microphone, now I can hear everything I speak echoed to me (with no app like skype even running.) And I can hear beeps in the terminal.
